meanings.definition: Used to refer to all the individual items in a group without exception.
meanings.sent1: Every student in the class raised their hand.
meanings.sent2: She reads every book in the library.
meanings.sent3: Every cookie in the jar mysteriously disappeared overnight.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled like every diamond in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher checked every homework assignment meticulously.

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize the individuality of each member of a specified group.
meanings.sent1: She wore a different outfit every day of the week.
meanings.sent2: Every person has a unique fingerprint.
meanings.sent3: The cat had a different meow for every family member.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as infectious as every smile in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted every petal on the flower with care.
